Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian pottery heavy chalice; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior reserved with faded black band at bottom; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine exactly the type of chalice. However, the thickness of the sherd suggests that the vessel was large, therefore a heavy chalice. Chalice kraters are found in the Mature Animal Style and in the Grand Style.
It is probable that the sherd belongs to the same chalice as 1888,0601.193, 1965,0930.40 and 1965,0930.169.
The sherd probably belongs to the same chalice as 1888,0601.193, 1965,0930,40, 169 and 171.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1349) (phase 2)
